Package com.intellij.lang

Class Language

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intellij.openapi.util.UserDataHolderBase
      • com.intellij.lang.Language
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    UserDataHolder, UserDataHolderEx
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BuildoutCfgLanguage, CommandLineLanguage, CompositeLanguage, EcmaScriptRegexpLanguage, EcmaScriptUnicodeRegexpLanguage, IgnoreLanguage, JavaLanguage, JqlLanguage, JShellLanguage, JsonLanguage, JspxFileViewProvider.JavaHolderMethodTreeLanguage, ManifestLanguage, MarkdownLanguage, MetaLanguage, PlainTextLanguage, PlantUMLLanguage, PropertiesLanguage, PyDocstringLanguageDialect, PyFunctionTypeAnnotationDialect, PyiLanguageDialect, PythonLanguage, PythonRegexpLanguage, PythonVerboseRegexpLanguage, RegExpLanguage, RestLanguage, RngCompactLanguage, ShLanguage, SPILanguage, TextMateLanguage, XPath2Language, XPathLanguage, XsltLanguage, YAMLLanguage, YouTrackLanguage

    public abstract class Language
extends UserDataHolderBase
    The base class for all programming language support implementations. Specific language implementations should inherit from this class and its registered instance wrapped with LanguageFileType via com.intellij.fileType extension point. There should be exactly one instance of each Language. It is usually created when creating LanguageFileType and can be retrieved later with findInstance(Class). For the list of standard languages, see StdLanguages.

    The language coming from file type can be changed by LanguageSubstitutor.
